definition: thoroughfare/to go straight ahead/to rush/to clash
(of water) to dash against/to mix with water/to infuse/to rinse/to flush/to develop (a film)/to rise in the air/to clash/to collide with
to collapse/to break or wear down/to defeat

sentences.english: The holy stream of thy music breaks through all stony obstacles and rushes on.
sentences.chinese: 这音乐的圣流冲垮坚固的阻障，奔涌向前。

sentences.english: A broken wood bridge, looked like was damaged by the thunderstorm.
sentences.chinese: 一个断裂的木桥，看上去象是被暴风雨冲垮的。

sentences.english: The water is rushing over the barrier, flooding a road.
sentences.chinese: 海水冲垮了防护堤，冲入道路。

sentences.english: Heavy rains have destroyed half of the major bridges and much of the river banks in Yongji County.
sentences.chinese: 大雨已经冲垮了半数主体桥梁及永济县的多数河堤。

sentences.english: The flood waters burst the dyke.
When Little Monkey Lele's home was burst apart by a flood, he had no house to return to.
sentences.chinese: 小猴子乐乐的家被大水冲垮了，无家可归。

sentences.english: The flooding began flushing out rat holes around the lake, triggering a literal rat race for higher ground.
sentences.chinese: 洪水冲垮了湖边的老鼠洞，大批老鼠逃到高处避水。

sentences.english: If you shorten up the pause, then you run back into the risk of overwhelming your server.
sentences.chinese: 如果缩短暂停时间，又将重新面临冲垮服务器的风险。

definition: (of a watercourse) to breach its dike/(of dikes) to collapse
to submerge/to drown/to flood/to drown out (also fig.)
